lead_paragraph: The economic gap within the African-American community is one of the most important factors in the rise of Black Lives Matter, led by a new generation of college graduates and students.

headline.print_headline: Black America and the Class Divide
headline.main: Black America and the Class Divide

snippet: The economic gap within the African-American community is one of the most important factors in the rise of Black Lives Matter, led by a new generation of college graduates and students.
abstract: Prof Henry Louis Gates Jr essay examines Black Lives Matter movement in context of history of civil rights movement in America; focusing on income inequality within black community itself, holds social and economic class division is one of most critical and overlooked factors in rise of movement led by new generation of college graduates and students.
